channel.title: Creepy/odd floating arm in Residue Processing. [Fixed]
channel.description:
I though maybe this was an intentional effect as the rest of the soldier bits can be found nearby. But I notice it doesn't appear this arm is being held up by anything. This is in Residue processing if you jump off the conveyor belts with the big round crusher things into the water below after the second tripmine.
Map: bm_c2a4c
setpos -50.197685 -1188.969238 -261.798981;setang -36.475700 -178.347717 -0.007162 ![bm_c2a4c0002.jpg|690x500](upload://shwWRPmcuqcBzX9JJnzuDOx28Ap.jpeg) ![bm_c2a4c0003.jpg|690x500](upload://hNZevcaVlqibkXqbn1caH9zz2g9.jpeg)

I can confirm this bug

item.source: Creepy/odd floating arm in Residue Processing. [Fixed]

item.title: Creepy/odd floating arm in Residue Processing. [Fixed]
item.dc:creator: FERGUS
item.description:
fdisk:

I just looked around here and I’m not sure there’s a way out so maybe you’re not supposed to be down here in the first place.

I fell down there aswell, seems strange that there’s no way up from there. After all, it’s a place where many will fail and fall and why put water at the bottom if you shouldn’t be down there?

Read full topic
item.source: Creepy/odd floating arm in Residue Processing. [Fixed]

item.title: Creepy/odd floating arm in Residue Processing. [Fixed]
item.dc:creator: Heisenberg
item.description:
I will report seeing this aswell. I have found many many objects that you can simply walk right through but if i spent all my time bug reporting i wouldnt enjoy the game, which is really frigging amazing and being from a bunch of people on there spare time they exceeded my expectations by a million %. I believe once we start seeing people on there second and third play-through the issues will arise a lot more because people have the time and wan to help out by reporting! For such a tight knit group they did a heck of a job removing a vast majority of the problems. I look forward to steam and the improvements they can make because this is already amazing but i know they want perfect!

Read full topic
item.source: Creepy/odd floating arm in Residue Processing. [Fixed]
